results.title: Staggered
results.creator_credit: Martin Clunes, Philippa Braithwaite and Big Deal Picures
results.brief_description: Neil Price (Clunes), a children’s toy salesman, is preparing to marry an upper crust girl named Hilary, despite the disapproval of her snobbish mother. Three days before the nuptials, on the night of his stag party, Neil has his drink spiked by best friend Gary, and is left stranded naked on a remote Scottish island. Neil has to somehow make his way back to London for his wedding, aided by the kindness of strangers. Naturally Neil falls into all manner of strife en route - he’s arrested, has an arm broken, survives an armed robbery, and steals several cars. Meanwhile in Neil’s mysterious absence, Gary and Hilary’s mother go to work on her so that she will marry Gary instead of Neil on her wedding day. This romantic comedy places the rubbery-faced Clunes (from TV’s Men behaving badly) in all kind of sticky situations as well as pairing him opposite the comely Carmen (Anna Chancellor), who assists Neil in his quest (and provides an alternate love interest). The film features an array of exaggerated types (repressed sexual deviants, wry octogenarians, duplicitous friends) to draw laughs as it places Neil in increasingly farcical scenarios. Cast includes Michael Praed, Michele Winstanley, Kate Byers, Sarah Winman, David Kossoff and Helena McCarthy.

results.title: Stagestruck 3
results.creator_credit: Bob Harvey, TLC Films and Spellcaster Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of 5 separate episodes, this is the final of a series of three videos on everything you would like to know about theatre production, and in particular, amateur theatre. Presented by Christina Barryk, aspects covered in this volume include: Stage manager’s tools of the trade, arranging of actors’ moves on stage, dress rehearsal hints and tips; Makeup techniques; Prop designing, casting and moulding; Technical rehearsal; Actors’ improvisation workshops, role-casting/role-playing, reality on stage; Costume design and making of costume, transforming actor into character. Final episode celebrates amateur dramatics, including the actors and the behind scenes technical crew. Also includes personal anecdotes interspersed thoughout the program.

results.title: Stagestruck 2
results.creator_credit: Bob Harvey, TLC Films and Spellcaster Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of 4 separate episodes, this is the second of a series of three videos on everything you would like to know about theatre production and in particular, amateur theatre. Presented by Christina Barryk, aspects covered in this volume include: Pantomimes; School plays; Makeup techniques; Costume selection; Actors workshop and improvisation; Set design preparation for first rehearsal; Lighting; Prop designing, construction and tracking; Stage manager’s hints and tips for keeping the production on track. Also includes personal anecdotes interspersed throughout the program.

results.title: Stagestruck 1
results.creator_credit: Bob Harvey, TLC Films and Spellcaster Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of 4 separate episodes, this is the first of a comprehensive and informative series of three videos on everything you would like to know about theatre production, and in particular, amateur theatre. Amateur dramatics attracts people of all ages, from different backgrounds and for various personal reasons and this series, through the help of professional actors, directors, designers and stage managers, provides expert help and guidance to newcomers and even old-hands. Presented by Christina Barryk, aspects covered include: Set design, planning, painting, construction and set change; Makeup techniques for character roles; Stage manager’s role; Drama director and Actors’ workshop; Props and costumes; Sound equipment; Artistic director’s role; Lighting; Touring companies. Also includes personal anecdotes interspersed throughout the program.

results.title: Stages
results.creator_credit: Robert Mellor and Macau Light Films
results.brief_description: Stage and screen director Peter Brook and performers from the Centre for International Theatre discuss their approach to drama. Excerpts from the play “L’Os”, “Ubu Roi”, “The Ik” and “The Conference of the Birds” which were performed in a disused quarry during the 1980 Adelaide Festival of Arts, illustrate their innovative approach to theatre.

results.title: Stages
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Stages salutes Canada’s performing artists, the singers, dancers and actors, some already famous and others struggling to make a name for themselves. In a film featuring a small group of them, they communicate through the medium of their craft the significance of being Canadian entertainers. Excerpts from such shows as Billy Bishop Goes to War, Margie Gillis’s one-woman show and Clemence Desrochers’s bitingly witty monologues highlight the vitality and multicultural flavour of the country’s performing arts. (Award: Salerno.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: Stagecoach (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Walter Wanger and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the story “Stage to Lordsburg” by Ernest Haycox. Passengers on a stagecoach heading for Lordsburg, New Mexico have a rough trip, during which Curly, the sheriff who is riding shotgun, arrests the Ringo Kid (John Wayne), who has broken out of prison to shoot it out with the Plummer brothers. Enroute, one passenger, a young officer’s wife, gives birth, with the aid of the Dr. Boone, an alcoholic and Dallas, a beautiful woman of questionable repute. Shortly thereafter, the stagecoach is attacked by Apaches. When they finally arrive in Lordsburg, Curly allows Ringo to settle his dispute, and make a getaway with Dallas, with whom he has fallen in love.
